utterance.speaker: KRIS HOWARD
utterance.content: Coffee shop on the south side of 67th and Lex. Take the 65th transverse across the park.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY COOPER
utterance.content: The tourists on 5th Avenue always screw up traffic.

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: It’s Madison.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: Probably running late.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Hey b*tch.

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Hey Madison.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: I’m sure this comes as a shock to you, but I’m running late.

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Of course you are.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: I’ll meet you there as soon as –

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Just my stupid lacrosse trophy. Anyways, I’m on my way in 5. Do you hear that?

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Hear what?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Hold on. Stay with me. Who’s there? Hello?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Madison?

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: Madison?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Shall I put on a little music?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you trying to get me in the mood, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes I am. In the mood to select one of these amazing wedding bands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve weeded out the hacks and selected five finalists.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A band? What’s a party without a DJ?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s rhetorical, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle, I don’t want some cheesy band leader trying to imitate Sinatra when we’re dancing our first dance to ‘Witchcraft’. I want Old Blue Eyes himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well – sadly, he’s not available.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but his recordings are. Via a DJ.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can we go back a second? Why would we be dancing to ‘Witchcraft’?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘cause it’s our song.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since we sang it in the karaoke bar in the Hamptons last summer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought our song was Bruce Springsteen’s ‘Dancing In The Dark’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since I had The Boss pull you onto the stage Courteney Cox style at The Beacon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we not have a song?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We must have a song.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it looks like they’re playing it now. Beckett. Murder at Sutton Place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fancy address for a homicide.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Fancy family. Our victim, Madison Beaumont. She was a senior at –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Faircroft Preparatory Academy. I recognize the crest. One of the many schools I attended on my road to greatness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so there’s signs of struggle. Looks like Madison put up a fight. Was she here alone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Parents were gone for the evening. Mother’s a designer, father’s some high powered defense attorney.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Forced entry?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, nothing’s missing either, so it probably wasn’t a burglary gone wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that … blood? Up there on the rafter?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Yes, and it’s hers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’d it get up there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, as far as we can tell, our killer threw Madison up there.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Which is probably what killed her. She has a major intracranial injury.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was thrown against the ceiling? That is a superhuman feat, bordering on physically impossible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Castle. Let’s hear it. What’s your outlandish theory?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t it obvious? Madison made The Hulk angry.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, Hulk or no Hulk, liver temp puts the time of death somewhere between 8 and 10 tonight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which fits with our 911 call. The call came in at 9:08 from a cabbie saying that someone was being attacked at this address.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A cabbie? Did he witness the murder?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re still not clear on that. We’re trying to track him down. Meanwhile Espo’s talking with Madison’s family back at the precinct.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I have to ask … do you know of anybody who might want to hurt your daughter?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We think whoever did this had to be unusually strong, muscular maybe. Do you know of anybody in her life –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who’s Riley?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Riley Mitchum. According to the Faircroft football website, he’s 6’2 and 210 pounds. There’s your Hulk, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, murder is at odds with the values instilled in a Faircroft man. I haven’t been back here since I was a senior.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this is where you graduated, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I would have if it wasn’t for the fact that one night my buddies and I sneaked in and pushed a cow up twelve flights of stairs and onto the roof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A cow? Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what happened? Did you guys get expelled?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Just me. I wasn’t connected like my buddies were. I was the scholarship kid, so I got the boot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well I think you turned out all right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: RILEY MITCHUM
utterance.content: Man, this is awful. I mean, Madison was like my first love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It must have hurt when she broke up with you.

utterance.speaker: RILEY
utterance.content: Wait, you guys have got it all wrong. I broke up with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not according to her mom.

utterance.speaker: RILEY
utterance.content: Her parents didn’t have a clue, okay? A couple months ago Madison started going out all times of the night. She wouldn’t tell me what she was up to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was she seeing someone else?

utterance.speaker: RILEY
utterance.content: I figured she had to be. But I never found out who.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night?

utterance.speaker: RILEY
utterance.content: I was with my new girl. You can ask her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, I’m going to need a name to confirm that. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan. I need you to check into Madison’s phone records and recent activity. Look for anyone new in her life.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it. Meantime, we located that cabbie. He says two female passengers saw the attack on a video call. They told him to call 911. Then they bolted from the cab.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But he gave us the building where he picked the girls up and the doorman there ID’d them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are they now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Same place you are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kris Howard, Hillary Cooper.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: It’s about Madison, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: We were Facetiming with her when it happened. It was horrifying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then why didn’t you call 911?

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: We just panicked. We were scared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of what?

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: That’d we’d be next.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Next? Did the attacker see you?

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: No, but –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Look, two weeks ago this thing happened in the cafeteria.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: Hey. The principal said we’re not supposed to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: You’ll have to ask him.

utterance.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterance.content: The principal will be with you in just a moment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, none of this adds up. What were those girls so afraid of? What happened in that cafeteria?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d offer a theory but I’m too busy having detention flashbacks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You must have spent a lot of time in this hallway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More than I did in class.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I bet that principal hated you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m wondering if hate is a strong enough word. Principal Dunan had to hire a crane to get that cow off the roof. But I’m sure that old battleax is long since retired. Put out to pasture, so to speak.

utterance.speaker: PRINCIPAL DUNAN
utterance.content: Was that a bovine reference, Mr. Rodgers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Principal Dunan, you’re … uh … still here.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: And sadly, you have returned.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: I see you have managed to extricate yourself from a life of delinquency, Mr. Rodgers, and become a writer.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: - of sorts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, actually, it’s Mr. Castle now.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: You’ll always be Rodgers to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to ask you a few questions about Madison Beaumont.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: It’s a terrible business. It’s a tragedy for the entire Faircroft family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Two of her friends, Kris Howard and Hillary Cooper, witnessed the murder over Facetime but they’re not willing to talk. We need to know why.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apparently it’s related to something that happened in the cafeteria recently?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Dunan?

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: I’ll tell you. But you have to agree not to make any of this public. It will damage the school’s reputation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We are in the middle of a murder investigation. You’re not exactly in the position to bargain here.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: Very well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m surprised he can use a computer.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: I’m old, not deaf, Mr. Rodgers. And undaunted by technology. Two weeks ago a student captured this event on his cell phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Event?

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: Yes. I removed the video from his phone. I didn’t want anyone to see it until the incident was fully understood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: High school guys playing hot or not? That’s the event?

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: Just wait.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: Jordan is a good student, but she’s a bit of a black sheep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she’s being bullied by our victim and her friends.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: Keep watching.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: That is the event.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The outcast. The mean girls. The rage that erupts in a telekinetic attack. This is a real life Carrie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This has got to be a hoax.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: I ran into the cafeteria as soon as it started. The place was in shambles. But if it was a hoax the perpetrator left no evidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, we’ll need a copy of this for analysis. Now, has anything like this happened before?

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … yes. At the crime scene. This explains Madison’s head wound, the blood on the rafters. Jordan threw her up there using the powers of her mind. Telekinesis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there a history of trouble between Jordan and Madison?

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: Not until recently. I heard a rumor that Madison and her friends were harassing Jordan. I reached out to her but she said she would prefer handling things herself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if this is how she handles things, no wonder Kris and Hillary were scared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to speak with Jordan.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: I’ll have her pulled from class.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t wait to tell Stephen about this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stephen King. He won’t believe it. A real life Carrie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I can’t say what happened in the cafeteria or in Madison’s bedroom – yet – but I can say this. The animosity between those two girls is what makes Jordan a person of interest, and not your telekinetic fantasy.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: I’m very sorry, but I’m afraid that Jordan is gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean she’s gone?

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: It seems that a student in her class came in and told everyone that the NYPD was here asking about Madison. Jordan got very upset and left the campus. Her teacher just called to inform us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I sent my partner to check. She wasn’t there. Ms. Payban, did Jordan ever mention a Madison Beaumont to you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Was she home last night?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Out where?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How did she seem when she got home?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Javi? Got a second?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: Yeah, it was totally Jordan.

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: No doubt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You never actually saw her.

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Well, we didn’t see anyone. It was if some invisible force threw Madison around the room like a ragdoll.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: The same way Jordan attacked us in the cafeteria.

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After you knocked into her as she carried a tray of food.

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Look, we know it was wrong of us to mess with her, but –

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: I mean, she’s odd, you know? She’s into weird stuff.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Comic books?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I found them all over Jordan’s room.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Big deal. She’s an X-Men fan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe because she’s one of them. Check it out. Telekinesis Unleashed. Developing Telekinetic Powers. Telekinesis For Beginners. And then … there’s this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon, bro. Let’s be serious.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah? Is this serious enough for you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s our victim.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I found it taped over Jordan’s desk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Was she always into this stuff?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about Jordan’s friends? Would they know where she is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you mind if we take a look at it? It might help us find out where she went.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, she’s a teenage girl. There’s gotta be someone that she’s hanging with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lucas Troy. And there he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… Starry Knight, the winter ball. Did I tell you Principal DUNAN expelled me just before prom?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, no! You didn’t get to go to your own prom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And my date would have been Audra Dobson. So unbelievably hot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if it’s any consolation I missed my prom as well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lucas Troy? Hi, I’m Detective Kate Beckett and this is my colleague Richard Castle. Do you have a minute?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS TROY
utterance.content: Yeah. Sorry. I’m just trying to get this done for tomorrow’s dance. I’ve been at it all week. At this point the inside of my lungs are probably cerulean blue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m surprised they’re not postponing the dance.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: No, Madison’s parents are insisting it go on in her memory. It’s amazing. Even after she’s dead everything’s still all about her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Obviously you’re not a fan.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: I didn’t like how she treated people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: People like Jordan Gibbs?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Yeah, but there’s no way Jordan would retaliate. The girl wouldn’t raise her hand at anyone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She wouldn’t have to. Not with flying chairs in her arsenal.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: I heard the rumors. I wasn’t there in the cafeteria, but I’m sure she wouldn’t do something like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but you were in her first period class this morning. Do you know where she went?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: She didn’t say a word to me. She just took off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lucas, we spoke to your teacher. She said that you left right after Jordan did. You were gone for 15 minutes. Where’d you go?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Look, I could see she was really upset so I just wanted to see if she was okay. So I went after her. But I lost her. At the 456 Subway station on 86th.

utterance.speaker: TECH AGENT TORI
utterance.content: Okay, so let’s start with the cafeteria video. There’s no indication that Jordan Gibbs or anyone else is moving the tables and chairs. Frankly, I can’t explain what we’re seeing here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I think I can offer an explanation –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the Facetime call made to Madison’s friends? Is there any way to retrieve that?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: A video call is like a phone call. Unless someone’s recording it, once the call ends the data is gone. As for Jordan’s laptop, browser history suggests she spent hours obsessing on all things telekinesis starting two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right about the time she telekinetically rearranged the cafeteria. Clearly Jordan had powers and was trying to understand them. This is exactly like the movie Carrie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, exactly like the movie. Fictional. Jordan doesn’t have powers.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. I’ve got Jordan’s phone records. Her service provider says that her phone’s been turned off, but she made one call right when she left school.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To whom?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Number’s listed to a Henderson Diagnostics and I can’t find any info on what they do exactly, but when I called there was no answer. No voicemail, or message either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get an address?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Brooklyn. Off the 45 line.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was Jordan doing all the way out here? It’s miles away from her house, the school …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just because no one knows who Jordan’s friends are doesn’t mean she doesn’t have any.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And her friends hang out at a place like this?

utterance.speaker: NERDY GUY
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. I’d like to ask you a few questions –

utterance.speaker: NERDY GUY
utterance.content: You must be here for the doctor. He’s in session now. Follow me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. NYPD. We’re looking –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - for …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think we’re in the right place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I saw that trick in Vegas. So who are you? What is this place?

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: I am Dr. Rampinel and this place is my lab, and what I do is not magic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then what is it?

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: I teach biophysics at MIT. I rent this space from Henderson to conduct my research in telekinesis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You study telekinesis?

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: I teach people how to unlock their potential.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For a fee, I’m guessing. They pay you enough, you make them believe they’re special.

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: I see you’re a skeptic. Most ungifted are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What can you tell us about Jordan Gibbs?

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: Ah yes, Jordan. She came by last week, I think, to have herself evaluated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did she do? Oh, let me guess. Off the charts?

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: I really can’t discuss my findings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Last week? But she called here this morning.

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: In fact, she did. Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did she say?

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: She was frightened. You see, Jordan doesn’t yet know how to control her powers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So did she come here to see you?

utterance.speaker: RAMPINEL
utterance.content: Yes. But she’s gone now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re lying. And if you don’t tell me the truth I’ll arrest you for obstruction and harboring a fugitive.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN GIBBS
utterance.content: Stop.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: Leave him alone. He’s just trying to protect me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She even kind of looks like Carrie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, she does not. Besides, how would that little skinny girl throw Madison up against the ceiling?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With powers we have yet to comprehend. Be careful in there. Don’t anger her. We don’t know what she’s capable of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. You should probably go in there with me. For protection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re a hard girl to find, Jordan.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: I had to get away from Faircroft. Everyone was whispering about how I was the one who killed Madison.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why would they say that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it because Madison was your nemesis?

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: She didn’t used to be. For the longest time I was invisible to Madison and her b*tch clique. Just like I am to most people. And then last month, the first morning back after winter break, I was in the library reading and I ran into her in the Russian Lit section, and she got all pissed, saying I couldn’t tell anyone that I’d seen her there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was she angry about?

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: I have no idea! Maybe she didn’t want anyone to know that she actually studies. But then, later that day, Madison started messing with me and it just got worse from there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you pulled that stunt in the cafeteria? To make her scared of you?

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: I just wanted them to stop!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that why you killed Madison?

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: I guess so. I don’t know!

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: It’s a nervous habit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jordan, there’s no guessing here. Either you did or you didn’t kill Madison.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: I got so angry and stuff just started flying around the cafeteria. And then I wished for Madison to be dead and the next thing I knew she was. It had to be me, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you between 8 and 10PM last night?

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: I was studying at Lulu’s Café in Astoria.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re going to have to kick her loose. Waitress confirmed that Jordan was at the café in Queens until 11.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she couldn’t have killed Madison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not with her bare hands, but who knows how far her secret telekinetic powers might reach.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, it turns out our victim might have had some secrets of her own.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you track down whoever Madison was seeing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: As far as I can tell, she wasn’t seeing anybody. But … these are her financials.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What kind of high school kid has financials?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Madison does. She had a dozen credit cards and she was wearing them out. Hermes handbags, Jimmy Choos, I’m talking tens of thousands of dollars.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what? Her parents were loaded.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but mommy and daddy weren’t springing for any of this stuff. The cards were in Madison’s name, paid off every month through her own secret bank account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where was this money coming from?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s what we’re trying to figure out. Plus, there’s more. A slew of credit card charges for late night cab rides and convenience store purchases.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that fits with what Madison’s ex-boyfriend said about her staying out to all hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, maybe she was going out, hitting the clubs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but on weeknights? And there are no bar or club charges here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And look at this. Remember how Jordan said her troubles with Madison began when school started back up with that run in in the library? According to this taxi charge, Madison was out and about that same morning at 5AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so she was going straight to school from wherever she was. But why would she stay out all night and then go to the school library?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was she doing that she didn’t want Jordan to know about?

utterance.speaker: LIBRARIAN
utterance.content: Students use their IDs to swipe in and out of the library. These are all the times Madison Beaumont entered and exited during this entire school year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so each of Madison’s early morning visits to the library happened after one of her all-nighters. She swiped in and out within five minutes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m guessing she wasn’t hanging out in Russian Lit to study.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Russian Literature. It’s right here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank God for the Kindle or I’d be out of a job in a couple of years. Kids just don’t read actual books anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless it’s “Voyna i Mir”. War and Peace in its original Russian, and look, there’s no dust here. It’s like someone pulled this out recently. And it’s lighter than I remember Tolstoy being.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are these … bank notes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are bonds. These are bearer bonds issued by the German government. These are payable to the bearer, no questions asked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: German bearer bonds? I thought that only existed in Die Hard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did Madison get her hands on these?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but there’s almost a million dollars here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s no mistake, Mr. Beaumont. And this money is just the tip of the iceberg.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Aside from the shopping spree, we found some odd charges on your daughter’s credit cards over the past few months.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Cab rides taken during the middle of the night. Do you have any idea what she was doing or where she was going?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you weren’t aware of this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We don’t know. But we did find something else in the school library.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Inside a hollowed out book with your daughter’s fingerprints all over it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: $2.3 million dollars in German bearer bonds.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are these your bearer bonds, Mr. Beaumont?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you know where your daughter could have gotten them?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No doubt Madison’s dad knew about those bearer bonds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If they have something to do with his daughter’s death then why wouldn’t he want to tell us about them?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re not going to know until we know where they came from.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re tracking the serial number on the bonds to see if we can locate the original owners, but it’s going to take some time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell was this girl mixed up in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what does it have to do with Jordan’s telekinesis?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing, because Jordan is not telekinetic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, explain that cafeteria video.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t, Castle. But I assure you, I will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what about Madison’s death? Being thrown around like a ragdoll by an unseen force?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, unseen doesn’t mean nobody was there. And the real question we should be asking is what is a seventeen year old doing with $2.3 million in bearer bonds? That probably got her killed, not some psychic assassin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, perhaps we’ll have to agree to disagree on that and agree to agree on this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Billboard’s Top 100 Most Romantic Songs of All Time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I figure our song has to be on that list somewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. I’m not choosing our song off of a list that includes – Def Leppard’s “Pour Some Sugar On Me”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … that song, I’m sure, ignited many a strip club romance in 1987. 1987. A year when The Bangles taught us how to walk like an Egyptian. Bon Jovi taught us to live on nothing but a prayer. And Rick Astley taught us how to laugh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re feeling nostalgic after being pulled back in time to your days at Faircroft Prep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s strange, going back. Everything seems smaller, yet unchanged. I mean, the hallways are the same, the principal is the same. The same banners for school dances. And why didn’t you go to your prom? I’m sure 17 year old Katherine Beckett had many a young suitor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, except rebel Becks was a little too cool to go to a silly dance, so I went to a poetry slam in the East Village instead. It’s one of those seminal moments that I kinda wish I hadn’t skipped out on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To the things we missed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And to those we didn’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. Get back to me as soon as you can. Hey. So still no word on the bearer bonds, but it’s looking more and more like Madison’s extracurriculars were more of a criminal nature.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’d you find?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s what CSU found. An antique ring. It was at the back of the shelf at the library. It must have slipped out of the book. But we were able to ID it as having been stolen in a burglary two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who did this ring belong to?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, to the mom of a kid that attends Faircroft. Turns out that a dozen Faircroft families have been burglarized over the past three months. Mainly watches and jewelry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess, the dates of the burglaries match the dates that Madison was out all night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bingo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She must have fenced what she stole, which explains why she was able to pay off her credit cards.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It also explains the early morning visits to the library. She’d stash her haul in Tolstoy after each burglary and if anyone caught on to her they’d never be able to find the loot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if they did find the loot they wouldn’t be able to connect it to her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I checked with all of Madison’s friends at school. None of them seem to know what she was up to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey hey. I got a hit on those bearer bonds. Turns out they were stolen months ago in an armed robbery of a bank in Floral Park. The crew cleaned out the safe deposit boxes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hold up. Are you saying that a 17 year old prep school robbed a bank?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. But she might have robbed the guy who robbed the bank. According to the police report, the prime suspect in the bank robbery was one Xiangzu Chen - - a former Triad enforcer who went into business for himself. Now, the DA had enough evidence to indict him, but his defense attorney got him off on a technicality and the bonds were never recovered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And how does any of this connect with Madison?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look who his defense attorney is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charles Beaumont, Madison’s father?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Madison must have heard about the bonds from her dad. Where Chen was hiding them and how much they were worth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a huge score for a budding thief.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if Chen found out that his lawyer’s little girl stole $2.3 million from him –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’d be motive to bash her skull against the ceiling.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. We’ve got a problem. Chen’s gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He went into hiding?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Put his house on the market. He moved out yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t sound like the actions of an innocent man. Where did he go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re trying to track him down but no one in his family’s talking. Ryan’s bringing in his realtor right now to see if she knows where he went.

utterance.speaker: REALTOR
utterance.content: No. No, I have no idea where he is. All I know is he was willing to take a huge loss to close immediately. He just wanted the house out of his name and the money into his account.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where were you supposed to send the money?

utterance.speaker: REALTOR
utterance.content: He gave me a routing number. To a bank in China.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did he give you any reason to why he was looking to unload so quickly?

utterance.speaker: REALTOR
utterance.content: No. He said he needed the money for business reasons, but I could tell he was hiding something. It’s my job to know everything about every home I sell, so I asked around. Apparently Mr. Chen is very superstitious. And according to the neighbors, something happened.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: REALTOR
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know what they’re putting in the water out there, but according to the next door neighbor, something chased Mr. Chen and his men out of the house a few nights ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean, something?

utterance.speaker: REALTOR
utterance.content: Some thing. As in –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A ghost?

utterance.speaker: REALTOR
utterance.content: This neighbor said he looked out his window and all of the patio furniture was flying around the yard. It scared the hell out of Mr. Chen. He and his men left the house and he never returned. Obviously that detail was left out of the listing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Chen didn’t just leave his house, he left the country. TSA confirms he was on a flight to Shanghai when Madison was murdered. He’s not our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me again why he left the country?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you’re not going to want to hear this, but I followed up with Chen’s neighbors. And several confirmed seeing what can only be described as a telekinetic event at Chen’s property three nights ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And remind me how stolen bearer bonds have nothing to do with telekinesis?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, there is a logical explanation, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d – love to hear it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Madison knew that those bonds were in Chen’s house. Her father is, after all, his lawyer. So um … she’s looking for the next big score, she’s scoping out the house, except Chen’s guards are around all the time. So knowing that Chen is superstitious, she stages a supernatural event to scare everyone out of the house.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s actually really … logical.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But what about the other events? The cafeteria?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dry run. See if she can pull it off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And her own death, did she stage that, too?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine, all right. You’re right. Um … Madison couldn’t have done this alone. So someone else was involved. You know what? Madison had to have had a partner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right. A partner with telekinetic abilities.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or someone with the ability to fake it. And when Madison wouldn’t share, the partner went after her. So we find Madison’s partner, we’ll find the killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Just heard back from CSU. They recovered a number of prints from Chen’s house. Matched a set to Madison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And to Jordan?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet, but they’re still in process. They also examined the patio where Chen’s furniture earned its frequent flyer miles. Found shoeprints with traces of blue iridescent spray paint on them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess. Cerulean blue?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, can you freeze that? Look there, on the left.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Let me see if I can zoom in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s him. It’s Lucas. He was at the cafeteria.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And apparently at Chen’s place, based on that paint.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Lucas was the one with the power and not Jordan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, the power to stage these events. But why would he be Madison’s accomplice? He said that he hated her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he came to hate her. That’s why he killed her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And with everyone assuming Jordan was the one with the telekinetic abilities, what better way to throw people off his scent?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That gun’s not going to be much help when Lucas rips it from your hands with his mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, for the last time, telekinesis is not re-

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were saying?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon. We’re going to finally figure out what’s going on here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: It’s not what you think.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Don’t hurt her!

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: She had nothing to do with this. It’s all my fault.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: I never meant for any of this to happen. I never meant for anyone to get hurt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what we saw at your house, that event at the cafeteria, that was you?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Yeah, you must think I’m a freak, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you do it?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: You wouldn’t understand. Most people don’t. That’s why I’ve learned to hide what I am.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Telekinetic.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: What? No. Smart. You know, people don’t like it when you’re smart and you do things people don’t understand. I mean, all that stuff that you saw? I rigged.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rigged? But you – chairs moved. The tables –

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Right. Special effects are kind of my hobby. It’s pretty amazing what you can do with some fishing wire and magnets. And people are pretty gullible.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: You know, when I saw those girls being so mean to Jordan, I just – I just wanted to make them stop. I figured if I made them afraid of her then they’ll leave her alone, you know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then you faked the whole telekinetic event at the cafeteria.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: What’s going to happen to him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That all depends on what he did.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: He was just trying to protect me. I’ve never had anyone do anything like that for me before.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: And it worked. I convinced everybody. Except Madison. She figured out what I’d done and then she threatened to – to turn me in to the administration if I didn’t help her. And you – you know what they would do to a scholarship kid who terrorized a room full of students?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did she ask you to do?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Uh … there was a house in Westchester. And she said she needed to get inside. And I was supposed to scare the owner out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what she was after in the house?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: No. No idea. I just wanted to do whatever she said so I could get on with my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why you killed her. Because she wouldn’t let you.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: No. I didn’t – I didn’t – I didn’t kill anybody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lucas, Madison was on a Facetime call when she was killed. Witnesses reported an invisible force tossing her around the room. They described it as a telekinetic event. Now, you just admitted to motive. And out of all of our suspects, you’re the only one capable of pulling that off.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, you’re right. I did pull that off. With Madison.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: It was the first thing Madison forced me to do. I made it look and sound like a Facetime call, but it’s just a video. Apparently one of her friends was pretty disturbed by the cafeteria stunt, so she did this to really freak her out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly how her friends describe it.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Now here’s just the end with no effects.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: How was that?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: That looked good.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Let’s play it back. She is so going to freak when she sees this. She’ll think your psycho sweetheart is coming for her next. All right, loser, help me get this harness off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When did you make this?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Uh … last week. I edited that last part out and emailed it to Madison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our killer must have gotten their hands on this. They used the video to cover their crime by making witnesses believe they were watching the murder live.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who else knew about this video?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Uh, as far as I know, just me, Madison, and whichever b*tch friend Madison pranked with this.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Then that friend is our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mind if I cut in?

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: Principal Dunan, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: I should ask you that. We found these inside your lockers, hidden under a false bottom inside. Care to explain?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me help you. It’s all stolen property from thefts connected to Madison Beaumont. The two of you were partners in her little bling ring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At least Madison was smart enough not to hide her stolen stash in her locker.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about. I’ve never seen that stuff before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think you have. We’ve matched each one of those items to property that was stolen from families that have students enrolled here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we’ve matched your movements to the times when the burglaries were committed.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: It’s bad enough you stole, but from the Faircroft community?

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: Don’t say a word. My dad’s a lawyer. He can get us out of anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even murder?

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You must have felt betrayed when Madison went after those bearer bonds alone. Score of a lifetime and she shut you out. Is that why you killed her?

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: Hello? We were halfway across town when that happened. There are witnesses. We saw her being killed on that Facetime call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean this call?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: She is so going to freak when she sees this. She’ll think your psycho sweetheart is coming for her next. All right, loser, help me get this harness off.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What you saw was a prerecorded joke video that Madison made. But by the time you watched it, she was already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our killer used it as an alibi to make look like she was halfway across town when the murder happened. She also witnessed it alongside a friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what you thought was a Facetime call was actually a video played on the killer’s phone. Isn’t that right, Kris.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: No. Please tell me you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: KRIS
utterance.content: Didn’t what? Didn’t want to play her psycho games anymore? I just wanted out. But when I told her, she wouldn’t let me quit. She said that she would destroy me. That she would destroy us. So I thought, why should we take the blame when she had already given me the perfect alibi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And all you had to do was match the crime scene to the video. Which is why you transferred Madison’s blood to the ceiling.

utterance.speaker: HILLARY
utterance.content: She is captain of the cheer squad. She knows her way to the top of the pyramid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what’s going to happen to Lucas?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I mean, his only crime was a B and E in which stolen goods were stolen and since recovered. So he’ll keep his freedom.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: And his scholarship. Although he will be on probation for the remainder of the term.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leniency, huh? Well, it’s nice to see that the administration has more compassion now than they did in my day.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: Mmm. Just one thing I need to know, Mr. – – Castle. It’s haunted me for years. Where did you get the cow?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Put it this way, sir, if you ever need one, I know a guy.

utterance.speaker: DUNAN
utterance.content: All right, where do you think you’re going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They look like they’re having fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Listen, I know that you’re a rebel and you hate convention and blah blah blah, but Kate, would you, um … … will you go to the dance with me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you regret it? That prank? Missing your prom? Not being here with Audra Dobson?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not even a little bit. Everything that I’ve ever done, every choice I’ve ever made, every terrible and wonderful thing that’s ever happened to me, it’s all led me to this moment, right here, with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve always loved this song.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve always loved this song.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could it be we just found a song?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Talk about magnetism.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, that reminds me. I had unis sweeps Lucas’s house. You know what they didn’t find? Wires, magnets, anything that would explain that stuff that we saw flying around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t think …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Now shut up and kiss me.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
